column4: how do you tell apt-get to go and meet all dependencies for a package?

so something in your sources.list is wrong, or your package lists are not up to date
what do you try to install ?
hmm, there is a official upgrade guide on the wiki
nd removed the sarge sources i hope
thats not good, dont mix ubuntu and debian
ubuntu/warty is to old for sid
this will certainly break ... if  not now, then on one of the next upgrades
you can do sarge to hoary (unstable)
but unstable means unstable ..... its a bit like debian unstable with experimental
then everything gets updated...you can be sure that between sarge and hoary all the versions are newer
256 are a requirement with gnome desktop
but this applys for the newer gnome .... with 2.0 128 was enough
